did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Files belonging to Rochester area gay rights activist, Mary McCrank, including news clippings, correspondence, posters, fliers, and a transcript of the debate in the Senate on a bias-related violence bill.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Files belonging to Rochester area gay rights activist, Mary McCrank, including newsclippings, correspondence, posters, fliers, and a transcript of the debate in the Senate on a bias-related violence bill.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Gay men -- Societies and clubs -- New York (State) -- Rochester.
Lesbians -- Societies and clubs -- New York (State) -- Rochester.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Mary McCrank papers, #7806. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

p.extref: Gay Alliance of the Genesee Valley records

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Arrangement and description of the Mary McCrank papers, #7806 made possible in part by a grant from the Documentary Heritage Program of the New York State Archives, a program of the State Education Department

scopecontent.p: Includes debate over gay priests, potential cause of AIDS identified.
Fliers, pamphlets, programs, invitations for conventions, events, resorts in and around Rochester.

did.unittitle: "Is the Church Today a Dysfunctional Family?: A Pastoral Letter from Matthew Fox to Cardinal Ratzinger"

scopecontent.p: An article of a letter from Matthew Fox, O.P., writing to Cardinal Ratzinger and the whole Church, defending his work against Ratzinger's criticisms that it is unorthodox, dangerous, and deviant.

did.unittitle: Letter from the Diocese of Rochester

scopecontent.p: Letter from Matthew Clark, Bishop of Rochester, thanking Mary McCrank for her support of their celebration for gay and lesbian Catholics.
